investigatorQuestion.text: The victim's phone records show multiple calls from your number that night. Why were you calling them?

maskAnswers.playerLine: We were coordinating on a time-sensitive project. I can show you the emails that prompted those calls.

lowTension.text: At midnight? What project runs that late?
Show me these emails. We'll verify them.

highTension.text: That would be helpful. Please forward those.
Work calls make sense. We'll confirm.
Good. Documentation always helps clear things up.

maskAnswers.playerLine: I was worried about them! They'd been acting strange lately. I just wanted to check in...

lowTension.text: Strange how? Were they afraid of someone?
Multiple calls from a worried friend... or a stalker?
Worried enough to call six times in an hour?

highTension.text: That's concerning. What seemed strange to you?
A caring friend. Did they answer any calls?
Your concern seems genuine. What were they worried about?

maskAnswers.playerLine: So what? I call people! It's not a crime to use a phone!

lowTension.text: Six calls in one hour before they died? That's not normal.
Your hostility is telling me a lot.
Evading the question only makes you look guilty.

highTension.text: You're right, but I need to understand the context.
No one's accusing you. Just explain the calls.
Relax. I'm just following up on the records.

maskAnswers.playerLine: We talked all the time, Detective. Best friends do that. I'm sure your records show plenty of friendly chats.

lowTension.text: Best friends? Earlier you said business associates.
Your story keeps changing. Which is it?
Friendly chats don't usually end in unanswered calls.

highTension.text: Close friends, I see. What did you discuss?
Did they pick up? What was the conversation about?
